name: Aajeevika
description: Aajeevika application of UNDP, India is funded by DIGITAL X Scale Accelerator Programme of Digital Office. Using the Aajeevika mobile app, rural women get connected with potential buyers of their products and Uttarakhand government can monitor the activity on LIVE dashboard of web version of this application.

SDGs.evidenceText: Aajeevika platform caters to SDG  goal  – “SDG 1 :No Poverty”. The Application contributes to SDG goal 1 as its objective is to improve the outreach of the products being sold by rural women for profit maximization which is envisaged to improve their financial status and help them to get out of poverty.

Aajeevika platform caters to SDG  goal  – “SDG 8: Decent Work and Economic Growth”. It contributes to SDG goal 8 as the app will  support  rural women owned micro rural enterprises used for  manufacturing marketable farm or non-farm products; this in turn  will lead to local economic growth and employment opportunities.

organizations.name: United Nations Development Program( UNDP) India

name: Angaza Elimu
description: Adaptive assessments for better learning outcomes

SDGs.evidenceText:
Angaza Elimu exists to ensure that every child has access to quality and relevant education on demand. Our team has developed an interactive eLearning platform powered by artificial intelligence which delivers personalized learning experiences to students and amplifies teacher student engagement. The platform has interactive and adaptive learning modules, giving students access to rich quality digital content and adaptive assessments. We provide teachers with a supportive tool to identify students' specific needs and help deliver personalized/customized instruction. 
 Parents also have the option to receive instant notifications about their children's performance and engage with teachers instantaneously  contributing to targeted, constructive, feedback.

name: Blood Safety Information System
description: System to monitor blood inventory from collection to transfusion.

name: Bob, the AI career coach
description: Bob supports jobseekers by helping them create a data-driven plan highlighting their main job search priorities, and coaching them to take action, thereby improving their employment outcomes

SDGs.evidenceText: Bob supports job seekers in their job search by providing them with key information and resources. It helps them better understand how to conduct their job search and how to move on it proactively. Bob promotes decent work and economic growth as it helps people find sustainable jobs in which they have a higher chance of staying.

name: Book Dash
description: Book Dash is a South African social impact publisher of free books for very young children. Our vision is that “Every child should own a hundred books by the age of five”, before they enter school! Book Dash gather volunteers to create new, African picturebooks that anyone can read, re-use, download, adapt and share.

SDGs.evidenceText: Access to books from a young age (books that are relevant, high-quality, and in mothertongue) is a key component to literacy development. Increasing levels of literacy has been shown on a micro and macro economic level to reduce poverty and inequality.

The WHO's Nurturing Care Framework outline the five components needed for young children and their carers to thrive (rather than merely survive) in health and wellbeing. Access to quality, relatable books in home languages play a vital supportive role in two of those components: Access to early learning opportunities and responsive caregiving. We need to think of early development of the whole child and books play a role in wellbeing and develop socio-emotional skills such as empathy and resilience, as much as they encourage cognitive development.

Increased access to books plays a fundamental role in quality education. Early access is appealing reading materials is linked to reading performance and quality is education is unlocked when a children can read fluently, with comprehension.

Increased access to books plays a fundamental role in providing quality education. Having many books from a young age has been proven to propel children further into education, increase chances of academic and economic success and reduce inequality.

name: Boxtribute
description: An open-source digital system making it easy to source, store & distribute aid rapidly to people in need in a fair and dignified way. Boxtribute provides web-app for organisations to run a free shop

SDGs.evidenceText: Our platform's most classic use targets SDG indicators 1.3-1.5, which includes providing basic services to people in poverty and other vulnerable situations, as well as improving the resilience of communities to disasters and other shocks

Much of our work has to do with the distribution of non-food items (NFI), in particular clothing and shelter items, which are often donated by the public when they no longer suit the needs of the individual. Through our work, we allow many household items that are otherwise in good condition to be redirected away from landfill and waste, towards providing for the core needs of vulnerable people. Without our platform, many community groups would have no way of organizing the donated goods and matching that to the needs of the population.

One of the key aspects of our work and in our platform is around encouraging collaboration and interdependence between public interest actors, particularly humanitarian aid actors. We are rolling out in our design the ability for organizations not only to store and distribute aid, but also transfer that aid between each other in a collaborative and cooperative way.

name: Cactus
description: A turbine performance simulation code, based on a free wake vortex method, to study wind turbines and marine hydrokinetic devices.

SDGs.evidenceText: A turbine performance simulation code, based on a free wake vortex method, to study wind turbines and marine hydrokinetic devices in order to lessen the impact on the climate.
A turbine performance simulation code, based on a free wake vortex method, to study wind turbines and marine hydrokinetic devices in order to lessen the impact on the climate.

name: CIREHA
description: Augmentative and alternative communication system that enables children with speech and language impairments to communicate

name: City Energy Analyst
description: A fully integrated urban building energy modeling tool that simulates building energy demand, energy supply potentials, system designs and optimization.

SDGs.evidenceText: This tool helps design low-carbon and low-cost energy systems.
This tool helps cities to forecast future energy demand under uncertain future scenarios.
This tool forecasts future energy demand under uncertain future scenarios and identify most robust envelope and system recommendation through comparisons.

organizations.name: Chair of Architecture and Building Systems

name: Cloudline
description: Providing carbon-free, unmanned aerial services at the frontier in developing markets for humanitarian uses. Our open-source work is focused on expanding the existing open-source software stack in PX4, to include a new vehicle mode, airships. We are also working on providing an open-source refrigerated container for drone delivery at 10kg payload, but are still in the process with the Open Hardware Repository, under a CERN open hardware licence.

SDGs.evidenceText: Cloudline aims to bring affordable logistics access to rural economics that are not connected to regional and global economics. Through outbound services to aid agencies and organizations, Cloudline hopes to enable and facilitate subsidised services to farmers and artisans all over the world. At a time when it costs more than two million dollars to build a kilometre of new paved road, large payload delivery drones allow us to reach communities that do not have the density to make roads viable, with the added benefit of a much smaller environmental footprint.

Cloudline improves patient access to medical products and services, empowers health workers to better serve their communities, and eliminates waste due to expiries and broken cold chains. Cloudline’s airships offer flexible active cold-chain delivery solutions, allowing affordable and timely, cold-chain-guaranteed transport of blood, vaccines, and other sensitive consumables, and collection and delivery of test samples from virtually any location to any other location nation-wide.

Cloudline aims to create new economic opportunities by opening up new markets in rural and hard to reach areas. Our aim is to hire locally, wherever we go. We plan to operate locally and provide all necessary training and up-skilling opportunities (engineering, data science, operations, management etc.) to create economic growth.

Cloudline designs, builds, and operates smart blimps, or autonomous airships. Our airships benefit from combining the lifting power of helium with advanced flight control and power train technologies to offer order-of-magnitude advantages over multi-copter and fixed-wing platforms. Indeed, when compared with UAVs currently being used for logistics, airships are safer (and therefore preferred by regulators), less expensive, more flexible, have a greater range and much greater carrying capacity.  Our South African engineering team is determined to solve core problems at home. The team has been privileged enough to know what seamless logistics looks like in a developed setting, while being close enough to places where that same access is near non-existent. The team brings our multidisciplinary knowledge of mechanical and electronics engineering, as well as Machine Learning, to problems that require expertise on a number of fronts.
Our airships run exclusively on electric power with zero emissions and substitute carbon emitting vehicles.

Cloudline believes in collaboration and partnerships with governments, private agencies and aid agencies towards achieving the UNICEF goals. In demonstration of our commitment towards this SDG goal, we are now in discussions with UNICEF, Red Cross, WFP and Village Reach on programs in Namibia, Philippines, Kenya, Sudan and DRC to deliver diagnostic samples, vaccines and medicines between facilities.

name: Coinsence
description: Platform to match youth volunteers to social enterprises

name: CommCare Android
description: Android App for CommCare, an easily customizable, open source mobile platform that supports frontline workers in low-resource settings. By replacing paper-based forms, frontline workers can use CommCare to track and support their clients with registration forms, checklists, SMS reminders, and multimedia.

SDGs.evidenceText: More studies have assessed CommCare's impact than any other mobile platform for frontline workers - they've demonstrated the tool can make health care service delivery more efficient and can help health institutions save money, among other things.

More studies have assessed CommCare's impact than any other mobile platform for frontline workers - they've demonstrated the tool can make health care service delivery more efficient and can help health institutions save money, among other things.

name: CommCare Cloud
description: Tools for standing up and managing a CommCare HQ server environment. An easily customizable, open source mobile platform that supports frontline workers in low-resource settings.

SDGs.evidenceText: More studies have assessed CommCare's impact than any other mobile platform for frontline workers - they've demonstrated the tool can make health care service delivery more efficient and can help health institutions save money, among other things.

More studies have assessed CommCare's impact than any other mobile platform for frontline workers - they've demonstrated the tool can make health care service delivery more efficient and can help health institutions save money, among other things.

name: Consul
description: Citizen participation and open government web application that helps public officials carry out participatory processes with their citizens. Through an accessible and friendly interface, governments can facilitate direct citizen participation through a number of activities, including citizen proposals, participatory budgets, collaborative legislation, debates and voting.

name: Coral
description: Open source commenting platform free from adtech and surveillance

SDGs.evidenceText: Online violence against women is a pervasive problem. By creating a strong community moderation platform and strategy guides, we help make the internet a safer place for women
Community engagement is a core piece of digital infrastructure. Our platform empowers moderation and community management to empower online conversation
Our platform, built and designed by a diverse team, is designed to create more productive, welcoming online communities, with software and research designed to reduce online racism and abuse

By designing safer community software for major media organizations, we empower both state broadcasters and local news startups to improve online dialog without the abuse and spam that plagues conversation

name: Deon
description: Deon is a command line tool that allows you to easily add an ethics checklist to your data science projects. We support creating a new, standalone checklist file or appending a checklist to an existing analysis in many common formats.

name: DiCRA
description: Data in Climate Resilient Agriculture (DiCRA) is a collaborative geospatial platform which provides open access to key geospatial datasets pertinent to climate resilient agriculture. These datasets are curated and validated through collaborative efforts of a large community of data scientists and citizen scientists across the world. The pattern detection and data insights emerging from DiCRA are aimed towards strengthening evidence-driven policy making for climate resilient food systems.

SDGs.evidenceText: The objective of the DiCRA platform is to provide free and open access to geospatial datasets through an open digital platform thereby enabling concrete evidence-driven policies and concerted action from all stakeholders involved in sustainable and climate resilient agriculture. Through geospatial analysis and data powered positive deviance approaches, the platform informs stakeholders on which farms are more resilient to extreme weather events. Indigenous knowledge is tapped through field validation and ethnography to suggest good practices on climate resilient farming that are already working well through bottom-up approaches, to feed into large scale agriculture programs and policies and optimize public investments on climate resilient agriculture.  DiCRA platform therefore contributes to SDG 2 to 'End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture'. Specifically DiCRA contributes to SDG target 2.4 which states 'By 2030, ensure sustainable food production systems and implement resilient agricultural practices that increase productivity and production, that help maintain ecosystems, that strengthen capacity for adaptation to climate change, extreme weather, drought, flooding and other disasters and that progressively improve land and soil quality.

The objective of the DiCRA platform is to provide free and open access to geospatial datasets through an open digital platform thereby enabling concrete evidence-driven policies and concerted action from all stakeholders involved in sustainable and climate resilient agriculture. Through geospatial analysis and data powered positive deviance approaches, the platform informs stakeholders on which farms are more resilient to extreme weather events. Indigenous knowledge is tapped through field validation and ethnography to suggest good practices on climate resilient farming that are already working well through bottom-up approaches, to feed into large scale agriculture programs and policies and optimize public investments on climate resilient agriculture.  DiCRA platform therefore contributes to SDG 13 'Take urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts'. With its objective to enhance climate adaptation measures through data-driven approaches as well as impact on policies for climate resilient agriculture, DiCRA platform contributes directly to SDG target 13.1 'Strengthen resilience and adaptive capacity to climate-related hazards and natural disasters in all countries' and SDG target 13.2 to 'Integrate climate change measures into national policies, strategies and planning'.

name: eKitabu
description: Personalized e-reading and learning app for children with disabilities

name: ekShop
description: ekShop is a fully open-source eCommerce platform that is customizable and configurable to your needs. It is completely free, adaptable and open to be supported by a worldwide community of volunteers and contributors. It's free and open source nature allows users to maintain complete control of the data content and modify it as they wish and according to their needs. Our intended goal is to allow any potential entrepreneur to quickly get up and running with an online platform to sell goods online.

SDGs.evidenceText: ekShop actively removes barriers for women and other gender identities to access the market and finance. It created specific gender-sensitive tools. ekShop is the only platform that provides direct connectivity for access to market and finance for the transgender population in Bangladesh. It empowers cottage, micro, small and medium enterprises (CMSMEs) led mainly by women entrepreneurs with open commerce platforms such as Anondomela, Joyeeta, WE, Digital Haat, and the e-market of Bangladesh Small and Cottage Industries Corporation (BSCIC) and SME Foundation. Besides, with the support of the United Nations Capital Development Fund (UNCDF), ekShop works to improve the online business capacity of entrepreneurs in Bangladesh, particularly women, empowering them to confidently adopt and leverage new digital services to enhance their competitiveness and performance. Currently, the platform houses at least 35% of women entrepreneurs through its network. 77% of the rural products marketed through ekShop are produced by women.

ekShop acts as an infrastructure in Bangladesh. ekShop delivery and other logistic connectivity have established as a collective and aggregated force in the industry, with 991 regional warehouses in operation, integrated 8 courier services including Pathao, e-courier, Paper Fly, Bangladesh Post, and 4600+ small entrepreneurs users. The platform has WTO + UPU connections established. ekShop is the only eCommerce platform-as-a-service Network, with 6 government platforms, including Joyeeta, BSCIC, and SME; 4 private, including Buy-Now and Anondomela; 4 international platforms, including Dukaanye Lilbaye. ekShop also offers single stock management for MSMEs for selling to all eCommerce platforms and ekShop Mall for SMEs designing their store for free. 
 ekShop brings in innovative technology, including complete BI tools. It introduced the country’s first ESCROW payment security in conjunction with the Bangladesh Bank guidelines. ekShop established countrywide geo-tag-based logistic mapping to any address, be it without a postcode, is automatically mapped.

name: elimu.ai
description: The elimu.ai software is a platform of educational content and Android apps. The software is designed in such a way that the children can learn fully autonomously, without guidance from qualified teachers. Instead, an AI tutor (Nya) guides each child through the necessary steps. The AI tutor gradually unlocks more advanced content, as the child demonstrates mastery of prerequisite skills.

SDGs.evidenceText: The purpose of elimu.ai is to provide every child with access to quality basic education.

name: EpiRust
description: Large-scale, fast, open source agent-based epidemic simulation using Rust language. Using EpiRust, researchers can simulate the spread of different diseases like smallpox, H1N1, and COVID-19.

SDGs.evidenceText: A researcher can simulate a communicable disease model for a city with a population of up to a few million agents using commodity hardware like laptops and desktops. Multi-city simulations (with populations of 100+ million) can as well be performed using a cluster of computers or within a cloud. EpiRust is one of the very few open-source epidemiology simulations which are fast and can scale upto 100+ million agents.

Sustainable cities need good policy making frameworks. Agent based models help policy makers to try different what-if and if-what scenarios. EpiRust can help researchers and policy makers to visualize the spread of an epidemic and implement necessary interventions to reduce the spread and minimize the impact, thereby leading to healthier and sustainable cities and communities.

name: Esri 2020 Land Cover
description: Esri 2020 Land Cover Map provides public access to global land use and land cover data with 10 meter resolution.

SDGs.evidenceText: Mapping global agricultural lands, and related land conversion, directly supports work to increase food security. Esri 2020 Land Cover 10m (IO) layer displays a global map of land use/land cover (LULC). The map is derived from ESA Sentinel-2 imagery at 10m resolution. It is a composite of LULC predictions for 10 classes throughout the year in order to generate a representative snapshot of 2020. It includes classifications for crops and flooded vegetation.
Mapped urban areas and trends in urban development can be seen on the LULC map. At 10m scale we can also identify large green spaces in urban areas and agricultural peripheries.

Land cover conversion plays a major role in CO2 emissions (e.g. deforestation and conversion of other natural habitats) as well as climate resilience (mapping forests, mangroves, etc, for nature-based climate solutions).  The LULC map, in combination with climate and carbon models, helps users identify important areas for natural carbon.
The LULC map is directly tied to how we live on land and can map land cover conversion over time.

name: Eviction maps
description: Data visualization tool for the Eviction Lab at Princeton University

name: farmOS
description: farmOS is a web-based application for farm management, planning, and record keeping.

SDGs.evidenceText: farmOS is used to track lab results that test food quality and compare against soil health practices.
A farmOS Produce Safety module was developed by the University of Vermont, which includes recordkeeping for on-farm water quality testing and worker hygience requirements.
farmOS provides record keeping and planning tools for farmers to monitor their operations.
farmOS can be used for traceability, tracking food production from seed to sale.
farmOS is being used to measure on farm carbon capture.

name: Feed the Monster
description: Feed the Monster is a mobile game that teaches children the fundamentals of reading, based on years of research and experience in the science of literacy.

SDGs.evidenceText: Research has shown that as little as 22 hours of usage can result in the equivalent of 2 months of literacy learning in a well-resourced school. The game is based on years of research and experience in the science of literacy. It incorporates key skills for literacy, including Phonological Awareness, Letter Recognition, Phonics, Vocabulary, and Sight Word Reading so kids can develop a strong foundation for reading. Feed the Monster has been localized to 50+ languages.

name: Geomancer
description: Geospatial feature engineering using OpenStreetMap data.

name: Gibbon
description: Created by teachers, Gibbon is the school platform which solves real problems encountered by educators every day. Being free, open source and flexible Gibbon can morph to meet the needs of a huge range of schools.

name: Global Biodiversity Information Facility
description: Platform providing open access to biodiversity data, includes a public API.

SDGs.evidenceText: Data gathered aids analyses of climate change, allowing for strategies to be developed and awareness to be spread, helping meet target 13.3
Data gathered aids analyses of invasive species and biodiversity changes, allowing for strategies to be developed for conservation and awareness to be spread, helping meet target 15.5

name: Global Human Settlement Layer
description: Open and free data and tools for assessing the human presence on the planet

SDGs.evidenceText: There are a number of SDG indicators that require an urban-rural disaggregation, for example SDG 1.1.1. The GHSL data were used to develop the Degree of Urbanisation method to delineate cities, urban and rural areas. The UN Statistical Commission endorsed thin in 2020 for international comparison including the SDGs

There are a number of SDG indicators that require an urban-rural disaggregation, for example SDG 2.4.1 The GHSL data were used to develop the Degree of Urbanisation method to delineate cities, urban and rural areas. The UN Statistical Commission endorsed thin in 2020 for international comparison including the SDGs.

There are a number of SDG indicators that require an urban-rural disaggregation, for example SDG 3.3.1. The GHSL data were used to develop the Degree of Urbanisation method to delineate cities, urban and rural areas. The UN Statistical Commission endorsed thin in 2020 for international comparison including the SDGs

There are a number of SDG indicators that require an urban-rural disaggregation, for example SDG 4.5.1. The GHSL data were used to develop the Degree of Urbanisation method to delineate cities, urban and rural areas. The UN Statistical Commission endorsed thin in 2020 for international comparison including the SDGs
In this article, the GHSL population data were used to assess the number of people with access to water.
The GHSL data on population and settlements can be used to assess the number of people with access to electricity disaggregated by urban and rural share
The GHSL data on population and settlements can measure the rural population with access to an all weather road
The multi-temporal data of built-up area and population density allow calculating the land use efficiency SDG 11.3.1

name: Gobierto Transparency
description: Gobierto is a Rails app that provides a set of tools to power efforts from public administrations towards transparency and citizen engagement, to enable them to communicate better with their constituents and put public open data to work.

SDGs.evidenceText: By providing better info about how government works and engaging citizens in public matters

name: Hikma Health EHR
description: A free and open-source electronic health record system designed to work offline in low-resource settings.

SDGs.evidenceText: The Hikma Health EHR enables clinicians in low-resource settings to collect and access patient health information to improve clinical decision making and improve long-term outcomes, particularly for patients with chronic illnesses.

name: Hive
description: Drone Monitoring and Management System to manage, control and monitor the network of drones

SDGs.evidenceText: A first step in the use our medical drones is likely to be deliveries between hospitals. The treatment of patients often requires the transfer of test samples or the delivery of medical supplies that may not be in stock everywhere. Such transfers could also take place between small regional hospitals with limited supplies and large health centers. The rapid transfer of samples to labs that are equipped to perform the required tests and the return of corresponding medication could save lives.

Prokura Innovation is the leading drone logistics and services company in Nepal established in 2017. It is one of the drone startups funded by the Unicef Innovation Fund and works closely with National Innovation Center with an aim to provide last mile delivery of medicines in the hardest to reach places of Nepal.

Delivery drones are operated autonomously or remotely, with operators potentially overseeing multiple drones at once. In several examples across the world, drones are being used for delivering time-sensitive items, such as medicine, or deliveries that would be difficult with traditional vehicle-based services.

name: Human Essentials
description: Human Essentials is an inventory management system for essentials banks, to aid them in distributing items to their partners, tracking their inventory, and providing statistics about their inventory flows.

SDGs.evidenceText: Essentials banks provide individuals with basic needs they cannot otherwise afford and helps them get out of a cycle of poverty. If you lack diapers you are unable to put your children in daycare, if you can't put your children in daycare you are unable to work, and the situation is exasperated.

Essential banks supply period products to those that wouldn't otherwise be able to afford them. Aside from the human diginity aspect, the lack of period supplies puts those who need them in the situation where they use products longer than intended or use other unsanitary and unsafe methods such as socks, pieces of clothing, and so on.

Essential banks supply period products to those that wouldn't otherwise be able to afford them. Aside from the human diginity aspect, the lack of period supplies puts those who need them in the situation where they use products longer than intended or use other unsanitary and unsafe methods such as socks, pieces of clothing, and so on.

name: I-Stem digital accessibility services
description: AI-powered document accessibility services that help convert inaccessible content into accessible and usable formats for people with print disabilities

SDGs.evidenceText: While there has been growing legal mandate in countries for Inclusive Education and employment opportunities, access to equal and quality education and equitable hiring opportunities remains a challenge for students with disabilities. For instance, the law mandates a 5% reservation for the disabled in India, but educational institutions are often at a loss in delivering inclusive education services, forcing students to rely on volunteers and often dropping out. Similarly, reasonable accommodations are still in their infancy at corporates throughout the country. Specifically, for people with print disabilities, this leads to much of the content (e.g. textbooks, handouts etc.) as well as over 97.4% of webpages remaining inaccessible due to it being incompatible with assistive technologies. Covid-19 has further exacerbated this challenge with social distancing leading to lack of volunteers and online education leading to a proliferation in the creation and sharing of inaccessible digital content. Thus, I-Stem, through our work in document accessibility seeks to end this "book famine", thereby promoting independence and self-reliance in education for all.

In our research over the last two years and in talking to hundreds of users and organizations in India and beyond, there are three critical aspects that organizations request when starting on their inclusion journey-accessible websites/apps and other digital portals, content accessibility services for their students/employees/users with disabilities and upskilling/training. This project is the first step in this direction in being able to provide organizations and people with disabilities the tools they need to convert any inaccessible content into accessible format (including complex content such as math, multi-column layouts, tables etc.). This not only helps people with disabilities access content in a reliable and efficient manner but also substantially saves time, effort and money (by upto 70%) spent by organizations to remediate content. This enhances access to information on an equal basis, leading to the community being able to contribute to the economy more meaningfully.

name: iHRIS
description: iHRIS is a free and open-source software solution that has been used in over 30 countries to more easily collect, maintain, and analyze health workforce data and manage health workforce resources at a ministry of health (MOH), district health offices, and health care facilities. iHRIS helps countries around the world track and manage their health workforce data to improve access to services.

SDGs.evidenceText: Countries use it to capture and maintain high-quality information for health workforce planning, management, regulation, and training for improved health outcomes.

name: impactMarket
description: impactMarket is a decentralised poverty alleviation protocol. It enables any vulnerable community to implement poverty alleviation mechanisms, like Unconditional Basic Income.

SDGs.evidenceText: Cash transfers, when unconditional, increase total expenditure and consumption at the individual household level, thereby contributing to poverty reduction. On top of this, using blockchain technology and Valora, mobile first approach, impactMarket is able to reach the most vulnerable communities that are unbanked, providing financial services to those who do not even have official forms of identification.Finally with, automation via smart contracts, no intermediaries are required for transactions, which means no operational costs.

name: Integreat
description: The digital integration platform Integreat enables governments and aid organizations to empower refugees and migrants.

name: Jellow AAC Communicator
description: Jellow Basic Communicator is a freely downloadable friendly Augmentative and Alternative Communication (AAC) system that uses icons/images to enable aid communication in people learning to speak or with difficulty with speech and language.

name: Juniper
description: Juniper is a set of tools built with and for public sector organisations looking to receive, hold and send crypto-denominated assets.

SDGs.evidenceText: Juniper is a tool that enables applications like the UNICEF CryptoFund

name: Kotani Pay
description: A technology stack that connects blockchain protocols, dApps, and blockchain fintechs to local payment channels in Africa

SDGs.evidenceText: Kotani Pay  enables the underprivileged such as refugees to receive Universal Basic Income Payments of at least $1 a day in collaboration with other humanitarian organizations
Kotani Pay improves financial inclusion by offering youth to perform microtasks and microwork and to earn from their work

name: NISE
aliases: National intelligence for Skills, Education, Employment and Entrepreneurship
description: An open source matchmaking platform aimed to ensure balance between supply side and demand side of skills, education, employment and entrepreneurship.

SDGs.evidenceText: NISE is designed to stimulate the quality of education to achieve SDG 4 by improving the online and offline accessibility to technical and vocational education and training (TVET) services. NISE is specifically helping to achieve SDG 4.3 (Equal access to affordable technical, vocational and higher education), SDG 4.4 (Increase the number of people with relevant skills for financial success) and SDG 4.5 (Ensure equal access to all levels of education and vocational training for the vulnerable, including persons with disabilities, indigenous peoples and children in vulnerable situations). The platform targets to provide equal accessibility for all people, with special focus on the vulnerable population- people with disabilities, people in geographically vulnerable areas, minor ethnic groups. In addition to facilitating equal accessibility to skills development for all, the platform incorporates academia supported career counseling, AI based career guidance, educational skills in blended mode to further ensure quality education. Thus, the platform is contributing to increase the quality and quantity of skilled youth who can be empowered enough to start their career as per their goals.

National Intelligence for Skills, Education, Employment & Entrepreneurship (NISE) is a one-stop digital solution connecting Government Departments/Ministries, public and private skills service providers, industries, and employable youths in a single platform. This is a real-time data driven matchmaking platform for the stakeholders of skills development, employment generation, and entrepreneurship to minimize the gap between supply and demand in the labor market to accomplish SDG 8.5 (Full employment and decent work with equal pay) and SDG 8.6 (Promote youth employment, education and training). This platform is designed to mitigate the challenges of skills mismatch that ultimately contributes to reducing unemployment problem and increases the efficiency of the labor market. To increase employability for the youth, NISE offers them accessibility to career counselling and guidance, job forecast, apprenticeship opportunities, business and entrepreneurship guidance, migration suggestions, etc. The platform’s real-time data enables the public and private skills service providers to analyze and identify the skills in demand and forecast future jobs so that they can plan their activities accordingly. To further reduce this supply-demand gap, the platform facilitates the industries to advertise job vacancies to specific audience, receive skilled youth, and maintain a supply-demand relationship with skills providers to simplify information sharing amongst them on emerging job opportunities, skilled HR, and market driven skills. Thus, NISE is essentially making impacts in economic development by preparing a demand driven skilled workforce. Youths equipped with proper skills will ultimately be able to secure decent and gainful employment not only in own country but also in abroad by ensuring skilled and safe migration and get equal pay as per their skillsets.

Youth unemployment is a global challenge, posing newer threats in the post COVID reality. Around the globe there are 621 million young people aged 15-24 years old who are not in education, employment or training and 75 million young people are trained but have no job. Most of these youth belong to the least-developed and developing countries where supply-demand gap is the key indicator of such unemployment issue. NISE has already been replicated in Somalia and Jordan to solve similar problem in these countries. The platform has received a number of global recognition and a few countries have shown interest to replicate it in their countries. NISE, if becomes an open-source platform, can contribute in achieving SDG 17 (Partnership for the Goals) as it may be replicated in other least-developed and developing countries in south-south and triangular cooperation to enhance their capacity to achieve previously mentioned SDGs by providing skills development, employment and entrepreneurship support.

name: NMF.earth
description: Understand and reduce your carbon footprint 🌱

SDGs.evidenceText: Help individuals to track their carbon footprint

name: NVDA
description: NVDA allows blind and vision impaired people to access and interact with the Windows operating system and many third party applications.

name: Oasis Loss Modelling Framework
description: The Oasis Loss Modelling Framework provides an open source platform for developing, deploying and executing catastrophe models.

SDGs.evidenceText: Oasis LMF seeks to unlock and change the world around catastrophe modelling to better understand risk in insurance and beyond.  While its development is largely driven by the global (re-)insurance community, it seeks to provide tools and utility to all. Their ecosystem consists of more than 18 suppliers covering over 90 models.

name: OCCRP Aleph
description: Aleph is a suite of data analysis tools for investigators that provides search and investigate open source datasets

SDGs.evidenceText: The goal of the Aleph project is to provide powerful technology to investigative journalists who want to track (mainly) white collar crime. The development is fully open, and coordinated by the data team at the Organized Crime and Corruption Reporting Project. With Aleph journalists can search and cross-reference more than one billion records to trace criminal connections and patterns and efficiently collaborate across borders.

The goal of the Aleph project is to provide powerful technology to investigative journalists who want to track (mainly) white collar crime. The development is fully open, and coordinated by the data team at the Organized Crime and Corruption Reporting Project. With Aleph journalists can search and cross-reference more than one billion records to trace criminal connections and patterns and efficiently collaborate across borders.

name: OnSSET
description: A GIS based optimization tool, developed to support electrification planning and decision making.

SDGs.evidenceText: The tool is focused on the assessment and deployment of conventional and renewable energy technologies aiming at ensuring access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all.

name: Open Collective
description: Open Collective is an online funding platform for open and transparent communities. We provide the tools to raise and share your finances in full transparency.

name: Open Foris Collect Mobile
description: Open Foris Collect Mobile is a fast, intuitive and flexible data collection tool for field-based surveys. This Android app allows the completion of complex data structures, such as biophysical, socio-economic or biodiversity surveys.

SDGs.evidenceText:
FAO has a long history in supporting countries on national forest monitoring and has developed a suite of open source tools under the Open Foris initiative (http://www.openforis.org/). By January 2021, total of 25 countries have used OF Collect in their National Forest Inventory (NFI) for collecting field data. 
OF Collect has been used in Chad for woodfuel assessment in areas surrounding to the refugee camps, and OF Collect Mobile has been used to gather transaction data and thus to ensure food supply in rural Bangladesh.  In addition, OF tools are used for example for socio-economic inventory in Mongolia and dairy industry survey in Kazakhstan. 
 Of the 50 countries that have submitted a FREL/FRL submission to the UNFCCC, 56% has used OF Collect to collect and manage data from their forest inventory.

By January 2021, total of 25 countries have used OF Collect in their National Forest Inventory (NFI) for collecting field data.

In addition, OF tools are used for example for socio-economic inventory in Mongolia and dairy industry survey in Kazakhstan. 
 Of the 50 countries that have submitted a FREL/FRL submission to the UNFCCC, 56% has used OF Collect to collect and manage data from their forest inventory.

organizations.name: Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) of the United Nations

name: Open Hospital
description: OH – Open Hospital is a free and open source software developed and supported by Informatici Senza Frontiere to provide a sustainable tool for the management of hospitals, health centers and facilities, with a strong focus on developing countries.

name: Open Referral
description: Open Referral develops data standards and open source tools that make it easier to share, find and use information about health, human, and social services.

SDGs.evidenceText: Every community faces a similar challenge: there are many different kinds of health, human, and social services that are available to people in need, yet no one way that information about them is produced and shared. Instead, many organizations collect and structure community resource directory data in different ways — yielding redundant, fragmented silos.  As a result, it’s hard to ‘see’ the safety net. Many people never discover services that could help improve their lives. Service providers spend precious time verifying data rather than helping people. And without access to this information, decision-makers struggle to evaluate community health and program effectiveness. This yields underperforming systems that fail people and communities in tragic ways.

Many people never discover services that could help improve their lives. Service providers spend precious time verifying data rather than helping people. And without access to this information, decision-makers struggle to evaluate community health and program effectiveness. This yields underperforming systems that fail people and communities in tragic ways.

Open Referral makes it easier for many institutions to collaborate on the management of information about the resources available to people in need – which can enhance partnerships, needs assessment, program evaluation, and institutional design.

name: Open Risk Manual
description: The Open Risk Manual is an open online repository of information for risk management developed and maintained by Open Risk. Our objective is to create a comprehensive, detailed, authoritative collection of risk management resources that are easily accessible by anybody, anywhere - well, network access is currently required.

SDGs.evidenceText: Risk Management is a vast and ever expanding domain of knowledge. The required skills are applied, occasionally very technical and ever changing. This specialized nature of the knowledge base is not served fully by either the traditional academic literature or classic publications in printed book form.
The Manual includes categories about Personal Financial Literacy (organized according to the financial competence framework for adults in the European Union)
The sustainable finance category organizes articles touching diverse Sustainable Finance topics

name: Open Terms Archive
description: Open Terms Archive tracks and makes visible changes to the Terms Of Service of the main online services.

SDGs.evidenceText: Open Terms Archive helps regulatory bodies assess the loyalty of 204 digital platforms and online services. It creates transparency in the practices of digital players, in line with the first recommendations discussed within the framework of the DSA and the DMA. And then makes institutions stronger when it comes to regulating digital platforms.

name: OpenBoxes
description: OpenBoxes is an open-source logistics management information system (LMIS) designed to serve the supply-chain management demands of public health systems.

SDGs.evidenceText: OpenBoxes provides health organizations with a free logistics management solutions designed for use in developing countries.

name: OpenFarm
description: A free and open database for farming and gardening knowledge. The platform allows farmers to interact and share their knowledge, practices and expertise with one another improving community generated education across borders.

SDGs.evidenceText: Because of the shared knowledge in farming, it is easier for struggling farmers to access education on various knowledge, tricks, and general farming expertise that leads to better crop production and reduces hunger and poverty generally.

name: OpenFisca France
description: OpenFisca is a versatile microsimulation free software. This repository contains the OpenFisca model of the French tax and benefit system.

name: OpenFisca
description: OpenFisca is a macro simulation modelling application which takes a set of tax rules written as code and calculates what economical impact these tax rules have on the economy and general income of a nation.

SDGs.evidenceText: It enables evidence based decision making for policy, to create just institutions (SDG 16.6 and 16.B))

name: OpenHIM
description: The OpenHIM is a middleware component designed to ease interoperability between disparate information systems. It provides secure communications and data governance as well as support for routing, orchestrating and translating requests as they flow between systems.

SDGs.evidenceText: Provides a gateway between external digital applications and other ICT Building Blocks, thereby ensuring interoperability and implementation of standards, which is essential for integrating various ICT Building Blocks and applications. By allowing different applications to exchange information, it can act as a mechanism to encourage or enforce best practices, clinical guidelines, and policy, in cross-facility workflows and business processes in the health system.

name: OpenHospital
description: Open Hospital (OH) is an electronic health record (EHR) application. Open Hospital is currently provided as a desktop application written in Java and it's designed to work without an internet connection.

name: OpenLitterMap
description: OpenLitterMap is an open, interactive, and accessible database of the world's litter and plastic pollution.

name: OpenMined
description: OpenMined is an open-source community whose goal is to make the world more privacy-preserving by lowering the barrier-to-entry to private AI technologies.

name: OpenTeleRehab
description: Open Source, Multidisciplinary Telerehabilitation Software

SDGs.evidenceText: Improve access to rehabilitation services and contribute to universal health coverage

name: Optikey
description: OptiKey is an on-screen keyboard that is designed to help people with motor and speech disabilities to interact with Windows computers and speak

SDGs.evidenceText: Optikey is a free accessibility tool which can be used by people with motor and speech disabilities to interact with their computer (for leisure, study, or work) and generate speech to be able to communicate effectively.

name: OS City
description: An improved, self-sovereign digital ID to make life easy.

SDGs.evidenceText: We are facilitating the creation of new businesses and licenses and permits to operate by creating more agile public institutions and fraud-proof, digital official documents. Also, by providing a new digital identity we foster the creation of a network economy around the citizen.

We are facilitating the digital transition for public institutions to that they can get the most out of the web 3.0. We help them issue and manage every official document as a blockchain assets, and to send it to citizens digital wallets.

name: OSCAR
aliases: Observing Systems Capability Analysis and Review Tool
description: OSCAR is a resource developed by the World Meteorological Organization (WMO) in support of Earth Observation applications, studies and global coordination. It contains quantitative user-defined requirements for observation of physical variables in application areas of WMO (i.e. related to weather, water and climate). OSCAR also provides detailed information on all earth observation satellites and instruments, and expert analyses of space-based capabilities. OSCAR/Surface is the World Meteorological Organization's official repository of WMO Integrated Global Observing Systems (WIGOS) metadata for all surface-based observing stations and platforms.

name: OSeMOSYS
description: OSeMOSYS is an open source modelling system for long-run integrated assessment and energy planning. It has been employed to develop energy systems models from the scale of continents (African Power Pools, South America, EU28+2) down to the scale of countries, regions and villages. Designed to require no upfront financial investment, a fast learning curve and little time commitment to operate, it is fit for use by communities of developers, modellers, academics up to policy makers.

SDGs.evidenceText: The project ensure that all men and women, in particular the poor and the vulnerable, have equal rights to economic resources, as well as access to basic services, ownership and control over land and other forms of property, inheritance, natural resources.
This project will substantially reduce the number of deaths and illnesses from hazardous chemicals and air, water and soil pollution and contamination.

It covers most energy sectors, including heat, electricity, and transport. OSeMOSYS is driven by exogenously defined energy services demands. These are then met through a set of technologies which draw on a set of resources, both characterized by their potentials and costs.
The project will ensure access for all to adequate, safe and affordable housing and basic services and upgrade slums.
The project will integrate climate change measures into national policies, strategies and planning

organizations.name: KTH Royal Institute of Technology, Division of Energy Systems

name: OTTAA Project
description: First AI based, predictive AAC platform for people with speech impairment

SDGs.evidenceText: OTTAA is fully aligned with the guidelines of #Envision2030, promoting and raising awareness of disability overall and how people with disabilities can reach SDG goals in general.   Focusing on good health and well-being, OTTAA as a support communication device, empowers people with speech impairments to make their own decisions regarding their health and medical treatments, easing diagnostics by communicating directly and not relying on a caregiver's opinion is key to achieve an overall sense of well-being. OTTAA provides several pictograms and pre-set sentences to ease communication in a medical setting.

OTTAA is fully aligned with the guidelines of #Envision2030, promoting and raising awareness of disability overall and how people with disabilities can reach SDG goals in general.  By giving someone a voice, allowing them to speak for themselves & to decide, is the most powerful thing that can happen to them, by using OTTAA they can express their political views, their needs and opinions allowing them to participate in their society.

By giving someone a voice, allowing them to speak for themselves & to decide, is the most powerful thing that can happen to them, by using OTTAA they can express their political views, their needs and opinions allowing them to participate in their society.

name: Our World in Data
description: Research and data to make and track progress against the world's largest problems. Allows for individuals and organisations to have a broad understanding of the state of the world. Includes tracking for SDGs.

SDGs.evidenceText: Related to Target 17.6 - Enhances knowledge sharing, specifically making this data available to individuals globally.

organizations.name: University of Oxford - Oxford Martin Programme on Global Development

name: Papers with Code
description: A free and open resource with Machine Learning papers, code, datasets, methods and evaluation tables.

SDGs.evidenceText: Accelerate scientific progress by making research easier to discover, reproduce and extend.

Papers with Code is a self-contained team within Facebook AI Research. It combines the best of both worlds: the stability, scale and perks of working within a leading technology company, and the agility, ambition and freedom of working in a startup.

name: PortableUTM
description: PortableUTM is an Open Source Initiative for enabling safe and regulations compliant drone operations around the world. The project is publicly released under GPU/GPL v3.0 licensing for the core features and MIT permissive license for the frontend and mobile apps.

SDGs.evidenceText: UTM systems are a Key part of drone ecosystem for enabling complex drone operations like medical delivery or emergency response
Drones are a key tool for improving health of people in poor infrastructure areas, UTM is one of tools for enabling this deliveries

name: PreSCo
description: Digital Health with advanced application of machine learning for advancing neonatal health

SDGs.evidenceText: We are aligned with Sustainable Development Goals SDG 3 for Good health and well-being, SDG 5 for Gender equality, SDG 10 for reduced inequalities. Our platform integrates urban and rural healthcare with the objective of meeting the current challenges of lack of resources, infrastructure, trained manpower and specialists in rural areas. In developing countries like India, more than 60 percent of the population is located in rural parts fo the country. Most of the times they have to travel to urban centres, on an average of 50 to 100 kms, to avail of quality healthcare. Upto 70 percent people even pay out of their pockets. This practice makes many drop out of treatments mid-way and even pushes close to 60 - 80 million people into poverty every year due to high healthcare costs. Especially, in the case of women and children, at least 40 percent babies and children lose their lives due to transport to urban tertiary centres. Health workers volunteering in the rural pockets, primary health centres and other rural healthcare service providers and professional are not equipped to handle these issues. Our platform harnesses the potential of artificial intelligence, machine learning and cloud architecture to provide for accessible and affordable quality healthcare to the hinterlands of the country to ensure equitable and universal healthcare to all.

name: Productive Forests
description: Satellite Imagery Processing for Machine Learning Based Image Classification. Produtive Forests creates a forest inventory to support the sustainable use of non-timber related forest products

SDGs.evidenceText: BIOVERSE was able to identify 5 -20 X more trees than initially known by the Indigenous Community of Kayapo and the Quilombola Community of Cachoeira Porteira. The economic impact of mapping the location of non-timber-related trees and serving the data to the community in the form of abundance maps makes a big difference in the harvesters' earnings potential. Productive Forests initiative directly impacts harvesting logistics and yields and, therefore, improves the lives of non-timber-related forest harvesters.

Forest communities have very few options for generating income. Most employment and revenue-generating opportunities are linked to cattle ranching, deforestation, logging, mining, illegal wildlife hunting, and animal trafficking. The Productive Forests initiative seeks to strengthen income generation from sustainable practices such as the harvest of non-timber-related trees species that produce fruits, nuts, sap, and extracts and secures perennial crop harvesting while maintaining the forest standing for subsequent generations.

name: Project Catalog Management Tool
description: PCMT is open source software that allows organizations to publish and manage product catalogs.  It supports GS1 standards for identifying products, capturing data from barcodes, and sharing data. PCMT also acts as a OpenHIE Product Registry, sharing master product data to enable interoperability across eHealth ecosystems.

name: Project Connect
description: Project Connect aims to create a global, live map of schools and their connection to the internet

SDGs.evidenceText: Project Connect continues as a venture inside UNICEF’s Office of Innovation within Magic Box, a platform for partners to come and connect their datasets and expertise to better understand the situation of children and youth, and to create insights that will help governments and other humanitarian actors improve their programmes around education, health and emergencies.

Project Connect continues as a venture inside UNICEF’s Office of Innovation within Magic Box, a platform for partners to come and connect their datasets and expertise to better understand the situation of children and youth, and to create insights that will help governments and other humanitarian actors improve their programmes around education, health and emergencies.

Project Connect continues as a venture inside UNICEF’s Office of Innovation within Magic Box, a platform for partners to come and connect their datasets and expertise to better understand the situation of children and youth, and to create insights that will help governments and other humanitarian actors improve their programmes around education, health and emergencies.

name: Project Konko
description: Project Konko is an Open Source Virtual Reality lesson creator built in Unity. It is designed & supported by NubianVR (www.nubianvr.com) and primarily targetted at the Oculus Go VR device - intended to be adapted to other devices down the line. It seeks to provide the tools that will allow developers, creators and educators to: (1)deploy 2D & 360 video lessons in Virtual Reality (2) manipulate 3D object in Virtual Reality environments (3) build multiple choice lesson assessment in Virtual Reality (4) maintain a badge & leaderboard functionality for Virtual Reality lessons.

SDGs.evidenceText: Using Virtual Reality as a Tool to Improve Instruction Quality

name: Project Lockdown
description: Project Lockdown (an initiative from The IO Foundation) is a civic tech, interactive platform providing an overview of the state of Human and Digital Rights around the globe.

SDGs.evidenceText: A convergence project between tech capacity building and open source development aimed at nurturing a Social Tech society that will demand the promotion and protection of Digital Rights and where programmers can embrace their new role as Human and Digital Rights defenders.

A convergence project between tech capacity building and open source development aimed at nurturing a Social Tech society that will demand the promotion and protection of Digital Rights and where programmers can embrace their new role as Human and Digital Rights defenders.

name: Project Sidewalk
description: Project Sidewalk aims to collect open datasets on sidewalk accessibility in cities.

SDGs.evidenceText:
Project Sidewalk seeks to collect open datasets on sidewalk accessibility. This data can be used by city governments to prioritize sidewalk repairs over data collection. Data collected has successfully been used in the past to lobby for more funding for sidewalk repairs. In the future, this data can be used in pedestrian routing applications that take into account different levels of mobility.

These uses for the data we help collect improve the health and well-being of anyone who uses the sidewalks. Furthermore, poor sidewalk infrastructure disproportionately impacts pedestrians that make use of wheelchairs, walkers, and canes. Improvements to the accessibility of sidewalks will help to reduce such inequalities. And finally, our project focuses on the design of accessible infrastructure, so we believe that it fits the Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure goal as well.

Data collected has successfully been used in the past to lobby for more funding for sidewalk repairs. In the future, this data can be used in pedestrian routing applications that take into account different levels of mobility.

Improvements to the accessibility of sidewalks will help to reduce such inequalities. And finally, our project focuses on the design of accessible infrastructure, so we believe that it fits the Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure goal as well.
